claim: The minimum eligible free rate for 5–17-year-old students in California continuation schools was 12.5%.
extra_info: Eligible free rates for students aged 5-17 = `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)` / `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`
reasoning: The minimum eligible free rate for 5-17-year-old students in California continuation schools, calculated as Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17) / Enrollment (Ages 5-17), is approximately 4.35% (Millennium High Alternative: 3/69), not 12.5% as claimed.

content.text: I'll start by exploring the database schema to understand the available tables and columns.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE frpm
(
    CDSCode                                       TEXT not null
        primary key,
    `Academic Year`                               TEXT  null,
    `County Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `District Code`                               INTEGER         null,
    `School Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `County Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Name`                               TEXT null,
    `School Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Type`                               TEXT null,
    `School Type`                                 TEXT null,
    `Educational Option Type`                     TEXT null,
    `NSLP Provision Status`                       TEXT null,
    `Charter School (Y/N)`                        INTEGER    null,
    `Charter School Number`                       TEXT  null,
    `Charter Funding Type`                        TEXT null,
    IRC                                           INTEGER    null,
    `Low Grade`                                   TEXT  null,
    `High Grade`                                  TEXT null,
    `Enrollment (K-12)`                           REAL      null,
    `Free Meal Count (K-12)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (K-12)`                           REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)`                 REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status` INTEGER    null,
    foreign key (CDSCode) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE satscores
(
    cds         TEXT not null
        primary key,
    rtype       TEXT  not null,
    sname       TEXT null,
    dname       TEXT null,
    cname       TEXT null,
    enroll12    INTEGER         not null,
    NumTstTakr  INTEGER          not null,
    AvgScrRead  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrMath  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrWrite INTEGER          null,
    NumGE1500   INTEGER          null,
--     PctGE1500   double      null,
        foreign key (cds) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE schools
(
    CDSCode     TEXT not null
        primary key,
    NCESDist    TEXT  null,
    NCESSchool  TEXT  null,
    StatusType  TEXT  not null,
    County      TEXT not null,
    District    TEXT not null,
    School      TEXT null,
    Street      TEXT null,
    StreetAbr   TEXT null,
    City        TEXT null,
    Zip         TEXT null,
    State       TEXT  null,
    MailStreet  TEXT null,
    MailStrAbr  TEXT null,
    MailCity    TEXT null,
    MailZip     TEXT null,
    MailState   TEXT  null,
    Phone       TEXT null,
    Ext         TEXT  null,
    Website     TEXT null,
    OpenDate    DATE        null,
    ClosedDate  DATE        null,
    Charter     INTEGER    null,
    CharterNum  TEXT  null,
    FundingType TEXT null,
    DOC         TEXT  not null,
    DOCType     TEXT not null,
    SOC         TEXT  null,
    SOCType     TEXT null,
    EdOpsCode   TEXT  null,
    EdOpsName   TEXT null,
    EILCode     TEXT  null,
    EILName     TEXT null,
    GSoffered   TEXT null,
    GSserved    TEXT  null,
    Virtual     TEXT  null,
    Magnet      INTEGER   null,
    Latitude    REAL      null,
    Longitude   REAL      null,

content.text: I can see "Continuation School" in both `Educational Option Type` (frpm table) and `EdOpsName` (schools table). Now let me calculate the minimum eligible free rate for continuation schools.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "
SELECT MIN(\"Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)\" / \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\" * 100) as min_free_rate
FROM frpm
WHERE \"Educational Option Type\" = 'Continuation School'
AND \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\" > 0;
"
input.description: Calculate minimum eligible free rate for continuation schools

content.text: The calculated minimum is about 4.35%, not 12.5%. Let me also check the pre-computed percentage column and verify with a few more queries.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "
SELECT MIN(\"Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)\") as min_pct
FROM frpm
WHERE \"Educational Option Type\" = 'Continuation School'
AND \"Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)\" IS NOT NULL;
"
input.description: Check the pre-computed percentage column minimum

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "
SELECT \"School Name\", \"Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)\", \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\", 
       ROUND(\"Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)\" * 100.0 / \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\", 2) as computed_rate,
       \"Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)\"
FROM frpm
WHERE \"Educational Option Type\" = 'Continuation School'
AND \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\" > 0
ORDER BY computed_rate ASC
LIMIT 10;
"
input.description: Show lowest free rate continuation schools

content.text:
The data shows that the minimum eligible free rate (computed as `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)` / `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`) for continuation schools is approximately **4.35%** (Millennium High Alternative: 3/69), not 12.5%.

Looking at the results, there are some schools with null enrollment values, and the value 12.5% doesn't match any particular minimum. The claim of 12.5% is contradicted by the data.

Let me verify there's no interpretation that could yield 12.5%:

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "
SELECT \"School Name\", \"Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)\", \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\",
       ROUND(\"Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)\" * 100.0 / \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\", 2) as computed_rate
FROM frpm
WHERE \"Educational Option Type\" = 'Continuation School'
AND \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\" > 0
AND ROUND(\"Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)\" * 100.0 / \"Enrollment (Ages 5-17)\", 2) BETWEEN 12.0 AND 13.0;
"
input.description: Check if any continuation school has exactly 12.5% rate

content.text:
No school has exactly 12.5%. The minimum rate is approximately 4.35%, which directly contradicts the claim of 12.5%.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "The minimum eligible free rate for 5-17-year-old students in California continuation schools, calculated as Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17) / Enrollment (Ages 5-17), is approximately 4.35% (Millennium High Alternative: 3/69), not 12.5% as claimed."}
```
